7.title: MQ One
7.description: El MQ One nace como una nueva plataforma de desarrollo que incluye todos los componentes necesarios y listos para usar con el fin de poder aprender fácilmente sobre programación de sistemas embebidos.

children.text: El proyecto ha consistido en el desarrollo del
desde la concepción y el diseño hasta su validación y montaje.
El MQ One se ha concebido como una
en el mundo de la electrónica listos para poder programarlos.
, con un encoder, un pulsador y 24 LEDs, hasta
: pantalla, Unidad de Medición Inercial (IMU), microSD, micrófono y altavoz.
Además, mediante un conector que lleva en la parte trasera, se le pueden conectar
, permitiendo la conexión de nuevos sensores o características.
El MQ One se basa en el
a 24 MHz que además incorpora 32 MB de memoria flash y 8 MB de memoria PSRAM. Posee además conectividad
y los archivos están disponibles en el siguiente repositorio de GitHub:
El MQ One lo he podido crear gracias a PCBWay, que me han fabricado y apoyado durante el desarrollo de las PCBs.
Registrándote en el siguiente enlace puedes conseguir 10$ de descuento en tu primer pedido!
El proyecto se ha dividido en dos fases:
, en la que se ha diseñado una PCB para probar las conexiones y uso de los distintos componentes que se han implementado en el MQ One. Para ello se han usado los
en su página web y que se pinchan a esta PCB.

29.title: MQ One
29.description: The MQ One is born as a new development platform that includes all the necessary components ready to use in order to easily learn about embedded systems programming.

children.text: The project consisted of the development of the
from conception and design to validation and assembly.
The MQ One has been conceived as a
most widely used components and sensors
in the world of electronics ready to be programmed.
, with an encoder, a pushbutton and 24 LEDs, to more
: display, Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU), microSD, microphone and speaker.
In addition, by means of a connector on the back,
, allowing the connection of new sensors or features.
The MQ One is based on the
with 32 MB of flash memory and 8 MB of PSRAM memory. It also has 2.4 GHz
and the files are available in the following GitHub repository:
I was able to create the MQ One thanks to PCBWay, who manufactured and supported me during the development of the PCBs.
By registering at the following link you can get $10 off your first order!
The project has been divided into two phases:
in which a PCB has been designed to test the connections and use of the different components that have been implemented in the MQ One. For this purpose, the
on its website have been used, which are attached to this PCB.
in which the main boards of the MQ One have been
The main board, the camera module board, the mountain module board and the development module board have been

Everything related to the selection of components, calculations, designs... can be found in the

were detected, which could be solved by reworking the soldering with 0.2 mm wire.
The following changes should be made for a new version.
In order for the card to work properly, some connections to the ESP32-S3 would have to be modified.

passes over the mechanical connectors of the
Although it has not generated problems, it may eventually generate
problems, so it would need to be fixed.
to validate the functionalities and components of both boards have been performed by means of
small firmware based on FreeRTOS and LVGL
has also been programmed using the
, the mountain module can be used to take data from the GPS and environmental sensor and the camera module.
of the MQ One has been a
During these months I have been able to learn electronic design, mechanical design, programming and, above all, how to make an
I close this way a very special stage in my life, finishing my university stage and taking with me friendships and learning for the future.
This project has not finished here, in a few months new news will come :)

En este archivo fuente, vamos a añadir todo lo necesario para

para poder guardar los búferes en la SPRAM.

/**********************
*      DEFINES
*********************/
#define CONFIG_LCD_HOST SPI3_HOST

#define BOARD_LCD_MOSI  39
#define BOARD_LCD_SCK   38
#define BOARD_LCD_CS    40
#define BOARD_LCD_RST   41
#define BOARD_LCD_DC    42

#define CONFIG_LCD_H_RES 240
#define CONFIG_LCD_V_RES 320
#define CONFIG_LCD_FREQ (80 * 1000 * 1000)
#define CONFIF_LCD_CMD_BITS 8
#define CONFIG_LCD_PARAM_BITS 8

#define BYTE_PER_PIXEL (LV_COLOR_FORMAT_GET_SIZE(LV_COLOR_FORMAT_RGB565)) /*will be 2 for RGB565 */

/**********************
*      VARIABLES
**********************/
esp_lcd_panel_handle_t panel_handle = NULL;

/**********************
* STATIC PROTOTYPES
**********************/
static void disp_init(void);

static void disp_flush(lv_display_t * disp, const lv_area_t * area, uint8_t * px_map);
